content:
The updated IG is now available for review here: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-unified/index.html

I'd prefer NOT to discuss this on the call, but instead to deal with questions/feedback on the list server or on http://chat.fhir.org so that we can make maximum use of call time to discuss content.

If anyone would like to assist in fleshing out the content and has a github account, let me know and I can give you committer privileges.
want me to commit additions emailed today? or will you? happy to become a committer.

To be a committer I'd need an email from you confirming that a) you've read and agree to abide by Chapter 16 of HL7's Governance & Operations Manual; and b) You've signed up for and agree to monitor the Zulip committer's thread.
But if you jump through those two hoops, I'm happy for you to commit your changes :)

IG is up and warnings with links are posted on all the old content. We've got about 4 hours before things are totally locked - so holler if there are any changes you think desparately need to be made: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/

thanks, @Lloyd McKenzie ! I see the HLA bundle was added as an artifact. Is it too late to add a link to it from http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/transplants.html? Something like "A first draft of developing a transaction bundle using guidance of this IG can be found here."
@Lloyd McKenzie fyi, I added the line to the github repo.
@Lloyd McKenzie http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/ isn't displaying correctly. Did I break something when I edited the transplants.html file?

Great. A reminder to everyone who has commit privileges to monitor the committers stream. Once Grahame says stuff is frozen, no commits of any kind unless Grahame oks the change - which is unlikely...
